answers.answer: It's all done on a curve. I would try to recall you Lmp. Diabetic babies can grow larger and quicker. If anyone in your family mom, sister or aunts have a diabetes history it needs to be diagnosed immediately
They check my sugar every time. And both my parents have diabetes.

Some women just have bigger babies. My mom had 10lbs babies and she did not have diabetes and was and still is perfectly healthy. I am a first time mom also and have been measuring ahead by 2 or 3 weeks also.  My diabetes test came back negative. They monitor me a bit more closely and I have had 4 ultrasounds to make sure I don't have too much or too little fluid around the baby but overall I just think some women have bigger babies or just measure larger. If it's a real concern your doctor would let you know, hope you don't have diabetes and everything will go fine :)

question: Yesterday: I had an ultrasound done today to check on the baby because of my health issues from the past. The baby is measuring 4 weeks bigger than what he should. I am 26+3wks and my baby boy is measuring 30wks and is weighing 3lbs! Should I be worried about this? I am still waiting on the results of the Gestational Diabetes test that I took Friday.Today: well went to the doctor and the stomach measurements that they do is measuring at 31wks.Should I be worried about having the baby early or is it normal to measure bigger? My doctor has not changed my due date since day one; should she have changed it being I am measuring way bigger?
title: First Time MOM measuring Bigger
